title: Connect frontend to Python backend
description: Create useAgentBackend hook to make HTTP calls to FastAPI endpoints. Implement /api/agents endpoint to fetch agent list. Test by displaying agent data from backend in the frontend.
notes: Successfully connected frontend to Python backend. Created useAgentBackend hook for API calls, AgentCanvas component with real-time agent rendering, and updated App.tsx to display live agents from LangGraph backend. Build verified successful.

title: Message Bubbles - Implement communication visualization bubbles
Implement camera controls (pan/zoom)
description: Add pan and zoom controls to the AgentCanvas component. Use mouse drag to pan and scroll wheel to zoom. Use React Three Fiber's Camera controls or OrbitControls. Update camera position based on input.

title: Pause/Resume Controls - Add simulation control buttons
Initialize Vite + React + TypeScript project
description: Set up the Vite project with React 19 and TypeScript. Use npm create vite@latest with React + TypeScript template. Configure tsconfig.json for strict mode, install necessary dependencies, and verify the project builds successfully with npm run dev.
notes: Successfully initialized Vite + React + TypeScript project with strict mode. All files created and production build verified. Project ready for Three.js integration.

title: Spec: Agent Movement
description:
## Agent Movement Spec (test-first)

### Goal
Implement smooth movement for agents between target positions.

### Unit Tests (before implementation)
- Movement interpolates over time (lerp)
- Agent reaches target within tolerance
- Movement can be paused

### E2E (agent-browser)
1. Load app
2. Trigger movement (button or auto)
3. Verify agent position updates visually

### Acceptance
- Smooth motion at 60fps
- No jitter
- Works with 3+ agents

title: Animated Sprites - Add walking/working animations to agents
Create basic agent sprite assets
description: Create simple pixel art sprites for agent states: idle, working, and communicating. Use a simple color-based design (16x16 or 32x32 pixels). Save as PNG files in assets/sprites/ directory.

title: OpenClaw Integration - Connect visualization to OpenClaw agent system
Spec: Pause/Resume Controls
description:
## Pause/Resume Controls Spec (test-first)

### Goal
Add pause/resume controls to stop/start agent movement.

### Unit Tests (before implementation)
- pauseMovement() sets paused=true and stops interpolation
- resumeMovement() sets paused=false and continues
- Movement loop checks paused state

### E2E (agent-browser)
1. Load app
2. Click Pause button
3. Wait 3s → agents should NOT move
4. Click Resume
5. Wait 3s → agents should move again

### Acceptance
- Single toggle or separate Pause/Resume buttons
- Visual indicator of paused state
- No agents move when paused

title: Spec: Animated Sprites
description:
## Animated Sprites Spec (test-first)

### Goal
Replace box geometry with 2D pixel art sprite frames for agent states.

### Unit Tests (before implementation)
- Sprite frame counter increments per animation tick
- Animation loops through frames correctly
- Different states use different frame sets (idle vs working vs communicating)

### E2E (agent-browser)
1. Load app
2. Verify sprites render (no fallback boxes)
3. Check different agents have correct colors/states

### Acceptance
- 2D sprites replace 3D boxes
- Animation frames cycle smoothly
- State-based color/style changes

title: Install Three.js + React Three Fiber
description: Install three, @types/three, @react-three/fiber, and @react-three/drei packages. Create a basic Three.js scene with a simple 2D sprite to verify rendering works.
notes: Previously completed but database not updated due to wrong working directory. Actual work completed: Three.js setup and shadcn/ui integration with Tailwind CSS.

title: Implement click detection for agents
description: Add raycasting or simple hit detection to detect clicks on agent sprites in the AgentCanvas component. Add onAgentClick callback prop and pass it up to parent component. Test with console log.

title: Spec: Connection Lines
description:
## Connection Lines Spec (test-first)

### Goal
Draw lines between agents that are communicating.

### Unit Tests (before implementation)
- shouldDrawLine returns true if agents are communicating
- line geometry connects agent positions
- line color matches communication state

### E2E (agent-browser)
1. Load app
2. Wait for communication state
3. Verify line renders between agents

### Acceptance
- Lines only appear during communication
- Lines connect correct agent pairs
- Lines disappear when communication ends

title: Spec: Background Scene component
description:
## Background Scene Component Specification

### Purpose
Create a pixel-art background for the agent visualization scene (office/workspace theme)

### Component Interface
```typescript
interface BackgroundSceneProps {
  width: number;
  height: number;
  theme?: 'office' | 'lab' | 'marketplace';
  parallax?: boolean;
}
```

### Tests Required (BEFORE implementation)
1. 
   - Render test (component mounts without errors)
   - Responsive test (adapts to canvas size)
   - Performance test (no excessive re-renders)

### Expected Behavior
```tsx
<BackgroundScene width={800} height={600} theme="office" />
```

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Component renders behind agents (z-index)
- [ ] Mouse events pass through to agents
- [ ] Pixel art scales correctly
- [ ] <5ms render time

### Implementation Steps (after tests pass)
1. Create test file first
2. Create BackgroundScene.tsx
3. Add office-themed pixel art
4. Integrate with AgentCanvas

title: Task Queue Display - Build task queue visualization panel
Connection Lines - Draw lines between collaborating agents
Set up LangGraph agent graph
description: Create the LangGraph state machine with perceive, reason, and act nodes. Define the AgentState TypedDict with agent_id, position, observations, reasoning, and action fields. Test with a simple mock agent.
notes: Successfully set up LangGraph agent engine. Created StateGraph with perceive -> reason -> act nodes. Integrated with FastAPI /api/agents/decide endpoint. Engine tested successfully with agent cycle.

title: Spec: Task Queue E2E
description:
## Task Queue E2E Spec (agent-browser)

### Goal
Validate Task Queue UI flow end-to-end before implementation.

### E2E Scenarios
1. Task Queue panel renders on load
2. Add Task flow creates a new task entry
3. Filter by status shows only matching tasks
4. Task click opens details panel

### Acceptance Criteria
- All 4 scenarios pass in agent-browser
- No console errors
- Works on desktop viewport 1280x720

### Plan
1. Start dev server
2. Use agent-browser: open → snapshot → click/type via refs
3. Record outputs in docs/e2e/task-queue.md
4. Implement Task Queue feature to make tests pass

title: Build agent detail panel component
description: Create AgentPanel component that displays selected agent details: id, state, position, and any available reasoning. Use shadcn/ui Card component. Show panel when agent is clicked.

title: Set up shadcn/ui components
description: Initialize shadcn/ui with the project. Add necessary components like Button, Card, Panel, and Tabs for the control panel UI. Configure Tailwind CSS if needed.
notes: Previously completed but database not updated due to wrong working directory. Actual work completed: Three.js setup and shadcn/ui integration with Tailwind CSS.

title: Implement first agent render on screen
description: Create the AgentCanvas component using React Three Fiber. Render a single agent sprite at position (0, 0, 0). Implement the useFrame hook for basic animation loop. Verify agent appears on screen.

title: Background Scene - Create office/workspace environment background
Initialize Tauri + React + TypeScript project
description: Set up the Tauri 2.x project with React 19 and TypeScript. Use npm create tauri-app@latest. Configure Vite, install dependencies, and verify the project builds successfully. Ensure all TypeScript configurations are set to strict mode.

title: Initialize Python FastAPI server
description: Create agent-backend directory with Python FastAPI setup. Set up requirements.txt with fastapi, uvicorn, langgraph, langchain-openai, pydantic. Create basic main.py with health check endpoint and verify server starts with uvicorn.

title: Agent Movement - Implement smooth agent movement between locations
